title: Man rams car onto sidewalk and stabs pedestrians, 14 wounded in South Korea
description: At least 5 people were hurt by the car, and 9 others were stabbed in a shopping district near a subway station in the city of Seongnam.

title: U.S. considers putting military on commercial ships in Strait of Hormuz amid seizures
description: It comes as thousands of Marines and sailors on both the amphibious assault ship USS Bataan and the USS Carter Hall, a landing ship, are on their way to the Persian Gulf.

title: Canadian travellers’ risk of leprosy ‘very low’ despite Florida uptick
description: Although leprosy rare are on the rise in Florida, travellers heading to the sunshine state have a minimal risk of contracting the disease.

title: Wagner fighters trying to unsettle NATO’s eastern flank, Polish PM says
description: Fighters from Russia's private Wagner mercenary force are being moved close to NATO's eastern flank to destabilize the military alliance, Poland's prime minister said on Thursday.

title: Niger’s military leaders shore up support as hundreds rally in the capital
description: The coup has been strongly condemned by Western countries and the West African regional bloc known as ECOWAS, which has threatened to use force.

title: Israeli law protecting PM Netanyahu challenged in Supreme Court
description: Netanyahu's governing coalition passed a law in March that limits removing a prime minister from office to cases of medical and mental incapacitation.

title: Ukraine’s ‘Chief Rabbi’ becomes wartime leader after viral videos
description: Moshe Azman, known as Ukraine's chief rabbi, has swapped his kippah and kittel for a helmet and flak jacket.

title: Feds try to reclaim $347 million insurance payout to Suncor linked to Libya unrest
description: Export Development Canada, which insures against losses caused by political violence, argues that Suncor's facilities in Libya still deliver returns for the Calgary-based company.

title: Curfew imposed in parts of northern India as 5 killed in religious violence
description: The clashes started when far-right Hindu Nationalist groups Vishwa Hindu Parishad and Bajrang Dal held a religious process through the Muslim quarter of Haryana's Nuh district.

title: Russia strikes Ukrainian port near Romanian border, sending grain prices higher
description: Russia has relentlessly attacked Ukrainian agricultural and port infrastructure for more than two weeks, since refusing to extend the Black Sea agreement.
